definition[0]: to make heat, light, liquid etc spread through something, or to spread like this
example[0]: The pollutants diffuse into the soil.
definition[1]: to spread ideas or information among a lot of people, or to spread like this
example[1]: Their ideas diffused quickly across Europe.
definition[2]: to make a bad feeling or situation less strong or serious
example[2]: an attempt to diffuse his anger
example[3]: The organization is large and diffuse.
definition[4]: using a lot of words and not explaining things clearly and directly
example[4]: His writing is diffuse and difficult to understand.
